text:
- Axis was amongst the
first private sector banks,

which just set up post
liberalization in 1994.

We are the third largest private
sector bank in the country.

We offer a whole suite of
products for our customers.

We have close to 4,900
branches and over 15,000 ATMs.

What we also have managed
to do over the last 30 years

is focus a lot in terms
of digital adoption,

over 90% of our transactions
are actually digitally enabled.
Cloud is absolute right and center

in terms of any of the tech
decisions that we end up doing.

Most of our consumer
facing new initiatives
are happening on Cloud.
We have actually now transitioned
the entire Amazon pay stack to AWS Cloud.

So the entire video, KYC
journey that Access Bank offers
to its customers, it runs on the Cloud.
We now have taken various workloads
like the buy now pay later scheme
that we have for the customers.

The credit card segment
that we essentially
for roll from our mobile app,
it runs completely from the Cloud.

We not only need to adopt Cloud,
we will probably need to go
and evangelize Cloud also internally,
not only within the organization,
but also within the tech function itself.

That is where the idea of
COE actually is terminated,

which has actually helped
accelerate the entire
option journey in Axis.
(bright music)
- AWS is a Cloud partner for Axis Bank.
My team has worked very closely
with AWS in the last three years to build
about 25 to 30 odd products,

and AWS worked very
closely with us to help us

come up with the right policies,
and the right frameworks,
and the right monitoring constructs
so that we could be safe and secure.
AWS has helped us really ease in building
our team and culture.

We do this annual hackathon,
we call it Bankathon,

and AWS is our partner for
running these hackathons.

We also borrow heavily from
AWS's culture of innovation.

Axis 2.0 is our end-to-end
digital business,

which means that any product
that is source digitally

and processed digitally
comes under this ambit.
The way to win in a digital product is not

to build one big bank
product and launch it,

but it is to make continuous
changes and deployments.

(indistinct) we do 45 deployments
a day means that we can do
that many more changes to our products

and we can be that much more
customer centric and agile.

And for us, this is our
competitive advantage.
And so Cloud and AWS help us do that.

We want to be known as a
benchmark digital global bank.

We also want to be known for
our people, our capabilities,
our technology, our processes,

our data analytics
capabilities, and the like.

And we are making
significant progress towards
achieving each of these objectives.
- If I were to look ahead, the focus areas

for us is in terms of, how
do we leverage data more,

and how do we do a lot more
cutting edge stuff around AI
and machine learning.

We are already working
with AWS in terms of

the entire large language
model and generative AI.

And these aspirations are
only possible on Cloud.
